file_content.text: Maybe I can salvage one of those destroyed Gormak relays. Think what we might learn!
You did it? You actually saw the Gormak communication relays? What were they like?
What's important is stopping the Gormak attacks.
Your safety matters more.
Your priorities are a little skewed.
That's all you care about?
I didn't get much of a look before I burned them out.
They're broken now.
Oh sorry, that must sound terrible--I'd just hoped for some more data, that's all.
Amazing, really. Thank you.
Go to those tech monoliths and find the relays. It's a shame, but they must be destroyed.
Are you the reinforcements? Wonderful, maybe my findings won't go to waste!
Oh, Master Jedi! Pardon me, but I desperately need someone to put my research to the test.
Um... Major? Is that right? I hate to ask, but if these findings are correct, I need the very best to help me.
Excuse me. Do you know anything about rewiring Gormak transceivers? Actually, I guess shooting them might work, too.
Excuse me, but if you're allied with the Republic, and not scared of a few Gormak, I could really use your help.
Ethen Wessiri. I'm researching Gormak technology. Checkpoints all over Voss are being bombarded with Gormak attacks. Us included.
And the Gormak always strike when the Voss commandos are off guard. I'd say there's a correlation, wouldn't you?
I take it you've found a way to protect these people.
Let's focus on stopping them.
I think few could call that a coincidence.
Indeed.
Sounds like they've improved their information-gathering.
So the Gormak have good intel.
You're saying the Gormak got one up on the Voss.
Cut the fancy talk.
This must have hit the Voss commandos hard.
How are the Voss doing?
There's been a lot of casualties. Because they're protecting us. So I stepped up my research.
This isn't a seminar. Explain.
You know those "tech monoliths" the Gormak build? By stealing Republic technology, they've converted them into communication relays.
But, I calculated that destroying just a few relays would render the whole network inoperable!
What you need is someone to handle those communication relays.
This is where I come in.
Yes. And all the Gormak protecting the relays will need "handling" too.
If it's so simple, why haven't these relays been destroyed?
Why not deactivate them, then?
The Voss commandos have their hands full just keeping us alive. And there aren't enough Republic forces about.
I could take care of it, but I have expenses to cover.
I'll need payment.
Ah. Well, I suppose my research grant is no use if I'm dead.
It won't be easy, but taking out the relays will stop the Gormak attacks. And, think how impressed the Voss will be.
Just tell me which relays to destroy.
Then I'll do it.
All right. Anything to get the Voss on the Republic's side.
And we need them as allies.
Marvelous, thank you! The relays are inside these Gormak tech monoliths nearby. They must be fascinating....
But please hurry. With the relays active, the Gormak could attack again at any moment.
Sorry, but no. [Refuse quest]
Oh. Then I'll send my research to the Republic. Maybe they'll send someone. Eventually.
Sorry, I can't get distracted, not when my findings are almost complete.
The Gormak won't be nearly as coordinated now. Our checkpoints should be safe. And you've proved several of my theories!
Those relays give the Gormak a planet-wide network, sharing data on Voss movements. Ingenious, really.
The Gormak forces won't be able to mobilize for a bit. But I wouldn't sit around. It won't be long before they figure out how to fix those monoliths.
Likely, they're trying to distract us from what they're up to in the marshes.
That relay network reaches all the way to Gorma-Koss. They can coordinate, and call for backup if they find this relic of theirs.
Ethen, focus.
